result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle M Bladorn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1, the Court sentences Ms. Bladorn to 2 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.

****Days credit for time already served:  the Court believes that Ms. Bladorn is entiteld to 320 days sentence credit for time already served, however the Court indicates that it is specifying that credit is to be determined by the DOC in accordance with the information provided on the Revocation Order and Warrant form.  ****

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 1:04pm. 
Defendant Danielle M Bladorn in court, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.   
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.
Ms. Bladorn makes a statement. 

On Count #1, the Court sentences Ms. Bladorn to 2 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.
The Court finds that Ms. Bladorn is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Ms. Bladorn is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Days credit for time already served:  the Court believes that Ms. Bladorn is entiteld to 320 days sentence credit for time already served, however the Court indicates that it is specifying that credit is to be determined by the DOC in accordance with the information provided on the Revocation Order and Warrant form.  

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment & follow through with any recommended treatment as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to submit to random urinalyses and other drug testing as determined by the Agent 
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent, except for incidental contact for work or school purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent, and except for contact as necessary for living arrangments 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed; to notify agent within 24 hours of any narcotic or prescription pain medication 
--no presence in any bars taverns or liquor stores
--to pay any unpaid balance due on court costs and surcharges
--to provide a DNA sample

Voting and firearm prohibition warnings are given
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentencing form is given 
Recess 1:29pm
Attorney Hagemann
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Order w/cover letter
Court's response to the defendant's 12/3/14 letter: No "new factors" or "cause" has been shown which would allow for modification of the order.
from Def. re: request for sentence modification

records.addlTxt: Request for Huber is denied
from Defendant requesting huber for all 6 months
With elements attached

Case called at 9:18 am
Defendant Danielle M Bladorn in court, in custody with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Bladorn waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1 of the information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3.

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges first 3 months for treatment, medical purposes and child care NOT for work purposes last 3 months can be for all purposes; to commence FORTHWITH 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random urinalyses/drug testing Court recommends no less than 2x per month but allows DOC to determine
--No contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the agent and incidental contact for work or school purposes as deemed appropriate by the agent
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed, notify agent within 24 hours of any narcotic or prescription pain medication 
--No presence in any bars taverns or liquor stores
--To pay costs of $268, plus $250 DNA surcharge
--To provide DNA sample

Days credit for time already served: 16 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given 

Court finds the defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program.

The Court indicates that if the DNA surcharge is found to be unconstitutional, and the Defendant has not yet paid the surcharge, then the Judgment of Conviction is to be amended to remove the surcharge payment requirement.  If the DNA surcharge has been paid and the ruling that found the DNA surcharge unconstitutional directs the clerks to reimburse the amount paid, then the clerk is to refund the amount paid to the Defendant. If the reimbursement is not mandated, then the amount will be kept.

Court will not allow expungement of this case.
recess: 9:48 am
Defendant's
Attorney Yelena Zarwell
Copy of Criminal Complaint
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 1, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Probable Cause Statement
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:41 pm
Judge Weston presiding for Branch 3
Defendant Danielle M Bladorn in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid   
  prescription
-Take all medications as prescribed
-No contact with any known drug offenders
-No contact direct or indrect with Kyle Spence 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Christine Sagmo or Kevin Sagmo

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:49 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 10/3/14 at 9:00 am
PTC:10/1/14 at 11:00 am
